column4: Hi - I am having problems with something called glx. I am running Ubuntu Edgy. Now apps I used to use on dapper aren't working like Armagetron, and I even tried to install beryl, and even that complains about glx.

Hi - I have a problem not necessarily Ubuntu related. I am trying to format a disk to ext3. I have used GParted - But that keeps returning an unspecified error. Using something called parted I got the error: Warning: "You requested a partition from 32.8kB to 120GB. The closest location we can manage is 31.7kB to 31.7kB.  Is this still acceptable to you?" Can someone please help me out here?
that almost sounds like the disk is bad..
anything on the disk you are trying to save?
- It sounds like it, but it was working in a computer recently.
ive had hard drives working.. then go 'click , click, CLUNK' and be dead. :(
while i was using the system. :()
- It was during an Ubuntu clean install that this disk seems to have died. Does this make it Ubuntu's fault?
not really.
drives die.. they are perhaps the most unreliable part of your pc.
you could try 'fdisk' and delete all the partitions, and have fdisk remake them.
you want to save the data on it? or just whipe it out?
fdisk may be able to whipe it out.. or go hard core and use 'dd' to zero the drive.. or try some other disk whiping tools.
if theres nothing worth saving on the hard drive.. use dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/drive   >BUT BE CAREFULL<
a typo in that line = trashed system
thats a bit extreme... id see if fdisk can delete the partitions first
also check the bios - see what sizes it says the drive is.
ive had a drive that had some issues and was getting reported tobe 2gb in size.. when it was 200 ...  controller on the drive messed up. = not fixable.
dd: writing to `/dev/hdb': Input/output error    is NOT a good sign
could try to have gparted make 2 partitions.. one a few mb (perhaps a gb) at the start of the drive.. then the rest at the end...
i wouldent trust that drive very much. ;
:) it pays to backup.
